parts:
Below are new multi-part questions modeled on the styles in Exercises 3A–3C from your PDF. fileciteturn0file0

## 20 Medium Questions

**M1.** Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.  
(a) \(5^3\times 5^7\)  
(b) \(a^{11}\div a^4\)  
(c) \((x^2)^5\)

**M2.** Write each as a single power.  
(a) \((2^4\times 2^9)\div 2^5\)  
(b) \(3^8\div (3^2\times 3^3)\)  
(c) \((7^5)^2\div 7^3\)

**M3.** Simplify.  
(a) \(12^6\div 3^6\)  
(b) \((9^3)^2\div 3^{10}\)  
(c) \(4^5\times 2^3\)

**M4.** Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.  
(a) \(h^3k^5\times h^4k^2\)  
(b) \(18p^7q^2\div 6p^3q^5\)  
(c) \((-10x^4y^3)\div(-2xy)\)

**M5.** Simplify.  
(a) \((a^2)^3\times a^5\)  
(b) \((b^3)^2\times(b^4)^3\)  
(c) \((c^6)^2\div c^5\)

**M6.** Simplify, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.  
(a) \(\left(\dfrac{m^3}{n^2}\right)^2\)  
(b) \(\left(\dfrac{2p^2}{q}\right)^3\)  
(c) \(\left(\dfrac{-3x^2}{y^3}\right)^2\)

**M7.** Given that \(\dfrac{x^5(x^2)^{3n}}{x^{n+4}}=x^{21}\):  
(a) Write the left-hand side as \(x^{\text{(something)}}\).  
(b) Find \(n\).

**M8.** Simplify each, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.  
(a) \((ab^2)^3\times(2a^2b)^2\)  
(b) \(c^2d^4\times(-5c^3d)^2\)

**M9.** Evaluate each without using a calculator.  
(a) \(37^0\)  
(b) \(\left(-\dfrac{5}{9}\right)^0\)  
(c) \((7m^3)^0\)  
(d) \((-2a^4b)^0\)

**M10.** Evaluate each without using a calculator.  
(a) \(2^{-4}\)  
(b) \((-3)^{-2}\)  
(c) \(\left(\dfrac{5}{2}\right)^{-3}\)  
(d) \((7^2)^{-1}\)

**M11.** Rewrite in radical form and hence evaluate (no calculator).  
(a) \(81^{1/2}\)  
(b) \(32^{1/5}\)  
(c) \(27^{-2/3}\)

**M12.** Evaluate without using a calculator.  
(a) \(216^{2/3}\)  
(b) \(16^{3/4}\)  
(c) \(8^{-4/3}\)

**M13.** Express each in index notation (simplify where possible).  
(a) \(\sqrt[3]{a^2}\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{1}{\sqrt[4]{b^3}}\)  
(c) \((\sqrt{c})^5\)

**M14.** Solve each equation.  
(a) \(3^n=81\)  
(b) \(2^p=\dfrac1{64}\)  
(c) \(10^q=0.001\)  
(d) \(\dfrac1{256}=4^k\)

**M15.** Given \(64\times 4^{3/2}=2^n\):  
(a) Evaluate \(4^{3/2}\).  
(b) Find \(n\).  
(c) Hence evaluate \(2^{\,n-5}\).

**M16.** Kumar deposits \$4000 at \(5\%\) per annum compounded yearly.  
(a) Find the amount after 2 years.  
(b) Find the total interest earned.

**M17.** A bank pays \(6\%\) per annum compounded half-yearly on \$6000.  
(a) Find the amount after 3 years.  
(b) Find the interest earned (nearest cent).

**M18.** Express each number in standard form.  
(a) \(0.0000456\)  
(b) \(93\,600\,000\)  
(c) \(0.00809\)  
(d) \(502\,000\)

**M19.** Express each in ordinary notation.  
(a) \(7.25\times10^5\)  
(b) \(4\times10^{-3}\)  
(c) \(1.08\times10^{-7}\)  
(d) \(3.6\times10^1\)

**M20.** Calculate and give your answer in standard form, correct to 3 significant figures.  
(a) \((2.4\times10^5)(3.5\times10^{-2})\)  
(b) \((6.2\times10^{-4})\div(3.1\times10^2)\)  
(c) \((5.6\times10^3)+(2.1\times10^4)\)  
(d) A satellite travels at \(7.8\) km/s. Find the distance travelled in 45 minutes, in metres in standard form.

---

## Medium Answers (very concise)

M1. (a) \(5^{10}\) (b) \(a^7\) (c) \(x^{10}\)  
M2. (a) \(2^8\) (b) \(3^3\) (c) \(7^7\)  
M3. (a) \(4096\) (b) \(9\) (c) \(8192\)  
M4. (a) \(h^7k^7\) (b) \(\dfrac{3p^4}{q^3}\) (c) \(5x^3y^2\)  
M5. (a) \(a^{11}\) (b) \(b^{18}\) (c) \(c^7\)  
M6. (a) \(\dfrac{m^6}{n^4}\) (b) \(\dfrac{8p^6}{q^3}\) (c) \(\dfrac{9x^4}{y^6}\)  
M7. (a) \(x^{1+5n}\) (b) \(n=4\)  
M8. (a) \(4a^7b^8\) (b) \(25c^8d^6\)  
M9. (a) \(1\) (b) \(1\) (c) \(1\) (d) \(1\)  
M10. (a) \(\tfrac1{16}\) (b) \(\tfrac1{9}\) (c) \(\tfrac8{125}\) (d) \(\tfrac1{49}\)  
M11. (a) \(9\) (b) \(2\) (c) \(\tfrac1{9}\)  
M12. (a) \(36\) (b) \(8\) (c) \(\tfrac1{16}\)  
M13. (a) \(a^{2/3}\) (b) \(b^{-3/4}\) (c) \(c^{5/2}\)  
M14. (a) \(n=4\) (b) \(p=-6\) (c) \(q=-3\) (d) \(k=-4\)  
M15. (a) \(8\) (b) \(n=9\) (c) \(16\)  
M16. (a) \$4410 (b) \$410  
M17. (a) \$7164.31 (b) \$1164.31  
M18. (a) \(4.56\times10^{-5}\) (b) \(9.36\times10^7\) (c) \(8.09\times10^{-3}\) (d) \(5.02\times10^5\)  
M19. (a) \(725000\) (b) \(0.004\) (c) \(0.000000108\) (d) \(36\)  
M20. (a) \(8.40\times10^3\) (b) \(2.00\times10^{-6}\) (c) \(2.66\times10^4\) (d) \(2.11\times10^7\text{ m}\)

---

## 20 Difficult Questions

**D1.** Simplify, expressing your answer in positive index form.  
(a) \((a^{-3}b^2)^2\times(ab^{-1})^3\)  
(b) \((x^4y^{-2})^{-1}\div(x^{-1}y^3)^2\)

**D2.** Simplify, expressing your answer in positive index form.  
(a) \(\dfrac{(3m^2n^{-1})^3}{9m^{-1}n^2}\)  
(b) \((-2p^{-3}q^2)^2\times(4pq^{-1})^{-1}\)

**D3.** Simplify each of the following.  
(a) \(\dfrac{(2x^3y^2)^2(x^{-1}y^5)}{4x^2y^3}\)  
(b) \((5a^0b^{-2})^{-3}\div(25b^4)\)

**D4.**  
(a) Simplify \((x^2y^{-3})^4(x^{-5}y^2)^2\) in positive index form.  
(b) Evaluate \(\dfrac{(6k^{-2})^0+3^{-1}}{2^{-2}}\).

**D5.** Write each as a single power and hence solve for \(n\).  
(a) \(\dfrac{3^{5}\cdot 3^{-2}\cdot 3^{n}}{3^{4}} = 3^{10}\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{2^{3n}\cdot 2^{4}}{2^{n-1}} = 2^{23}\)

**D6.** Solve for \(n\).  
(a) \(\dfrac{x^{5}(x^{3})^{2n-1}}{x^{n+4}}=x^{10}\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{(y^{2})^{n+1}}{y^{3n-5}}=y^{4}\)

**D7.** Given that \(3^a\times 9^b=3^{19}\) and \(27^a\div 3^b=3^8\):  
(a) Find \(a\) and \(b\).  
(b) Hence find \(3^{a-b}\).

**D8.** Evaluate without using a calculator.  
(a) \(125^{-2/3}\)  
(b) \(81^{3/4}\)  
(c) \(\left(\dfrac{27}{8}\right)^{4/3}\) (as a decimal)

**D9.** Simplify, expressing your answers in positive index form.  
(a) \(\dfrac{1}{\sqrt[3]{a^5}}\times\sqrt[3]{a^2}\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{\sqrt[4]{16x^6}}{\sqrt{x}}\)  
(c) \(\dfrac{\sqrt[3]{27b^4}}{b^{1/3}}\)

**D10.** Solve each equation (assume variables are positive).  
(a) \(p^{3/2}=27\)  
(b) \(q^{-1/2}=4\)  
(c) \(r^{4/3}=16\)  
(d) \(16^{x}=2^{10}\)

**D11.** Evaluate without using a calculator.  
(a) \((8^{-5/3})(2^{4})\)  
(b) \((64^{1/2})\div(4^{-1})\)  
(c) \(16^{-3/4}+2^{-2}\)

**D12.** \$12,000 is invested at \(4.8\%\) per annum.  
(a) Find the amount after 5 years if compounded monthly (nearest cent).  
(b) Find the total interest (nearest cent).  
(c) Find the amount after 5 years if compounded yearly (nearest cent).

**D13.** An investment of \$8000 grows to \$9720 in 4 years compounded yearly.  
(a) Find the annual interest rate, correct to 2 decimal places.  
(b) Using this rate, find the amount after 4 years if compounded half-yearly (nearest cent).

**D14.** A loan charges \(3.6\%\) per annum compounded quarterly. After 2 years, the amount owed is \$15,642.30.  
(a) Find the principal (nearest cent).  
(b) Find the total interest (nearest cent).

**D15.** Cheryl invested \$5000 and received \$5800 after 5 years compounded yearly.  
(a) Find the annual interest rate, correct to 2 decimal places.  
(b) Using this rate, find the amount after 5 years if compounded monthly (nearest cent).

**D16.** Calculate, giving your answer in standard form correct to 3 significant figures.  
(a) \((3.6\times10^8)\div(9\times10^{-3})\)  
(b) \((4.2\times10^{-7})+(5.8\times10^{-8})\)  
(c) \((7.5\times10^5)-(6.98\times10^5)\)

**D17.** Calculate, giving your answer in standard form correct to 3 significant figures.  
(a) \((1.2\times10^3)^3\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{(6.4\times10^{-2})(3.0\times10^5)}{8\times10^3}\)  
(c) \(\dfrac{2.4\times10^{-10}}{7.5\times10^{-6}-2.5\times10^{-6}}\)

**D18.** A virus has diameter \(85\) nm and a bacterium has diameter \(3.4\ \mu\text{m}\). (Given \(1\text{ nm}=10^{-9}\text{ m}\), \(1\ \mu\text{m}=10^{-6}\text{ m}\).)  
(a) Express both diameters in metres in standard form.  
(b) Express virus : bacterium as a ratio of two integers in simplest form.

**D19.** The speed of light is \(3.00\times10^8\) m/s. A spacecraft is \(7.8\times10^{10}\) m away.  
(a) Find the time taken for light to reach it, in seconds in standard form (3 s.f.).  
(b) Convert your time in (a) into minutes and seconds.  
(c) Express the distance in kilometres in standard form.

**D20.** The table shows approximate world population:

- 1800: \(9.9\times10^8\)  
- 1900: \(1.65\times10^9\)  
- 2000: \(6.14\times10^9\)  
- 2020: \(7.80\times10^9\)

Find:  
(a) the increase from 1800 to 1900 in standard form,  
(b) the number of times the population in 2000 is as large as in 1900 (3 s.f.),  
(c) the percentage of the world population in 2020 represented by \(1.28\times10^9\) (3 s.f.).

---

## Difficult Answers (very concise)

D1. (a) \(\dfrac{b}{a^3}\) (b) \(\dfrac{1}{x^2y^4}\)  
D2. (a) \(\dfrac{3m^7}{n^5}\) (b) \(\dfrac{q^5}{p^7}\)  
D3. (a) \(x^3y^6\) (b) \(\dfrac{b^2}{3125}\)  
D4. (a) \(\dfrac{1}{x^2y^8}\) (b) \(\dfrac{16}{3}\)  
D5. (a) \(n=11\) (b) \(n=9\)  
D6. (a) \(n=3\) (b) \(n=3\)  
D7. (a) \(a=5,\ b=7\) (b) \(\dfrac{1}{9}\)  
D8. (a) \(\tfrac1{25}\) (b) \(27\) (c) \(5.0625\)  
D9. (a) \(\tfrac1a\) (b) \(2x\) (c) \(3b\)  
D10. (a) \(p=9\) (b) \(q=\tfrac1{16}\) (c) \(r=8\) (d) \(x=\tfrac52\)  
D11. (a) \(\tfrac12\) (b) \(32\) (c) \(\tfrac38\)  
D12. (a) \$15247.69 (b) \$3247.69 (c) \$15170.07  
D13. (a) \(4.99\%\) (b) \$9743.42  
D14. (a) \$14560.33 (b) \$1081.97  
D15. (a) \(3.01\%\) (b) \$5810.98  
D16. (a) \(4.00\times10^{10}\) (b) \(4.78\times10^{-7}\) (c) \(5.20\times10^{4}\)  
D17. (a) \(1.73\times10^{9}\) (b) \(2.40\) (c) \(4.80\times10^{-5}\)  
D18. (a) \(8.5\times10^{-8}\text{ m},\ 3.4\times10^{-6}\text{ m}\) (b) \(1:40\)  
D19. (a) \(2.60\times10^{2}\text{ s}\) (b) \(4\text{ min }20\text{ s}\) (c) \(7.8\times10^{7}\text{ km}\)  
D20. (a) \(6.6\times10^{8}\) (b) \(3.72\) (c) \(16.4\%\)

\documentclass[12pt]{article}

\usepackage{amsmath,amssymb}
\usepackage[margin=1in]{geometry}
\usepackage{enumitem}

\setlength{\parindent}{0pt}

\begin{document}

\section*{Indices (Exercises 3A--3C Style): New Practice}

\subsection*{20 Medium Questions}

\begin{enumerate}[label=\textbf{M\arabic*.}, leftmargin=*, itemsep=1.1em]

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $5^3\times 5^7$
\item $a^{11}\div a^4$
\item $(x^2)^5$
\end{enumerate}

\item Write each as a single power.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(2^4\times 2^9)\div 2^5$
\item $3^8\div (3^2\times 3^3)$
\item $(7^5)^2\div 7^3$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $12^6\div 3^6$
\item $(9^3)^2\div 3^{10}$
\item $4^5\times 2^3$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $h^3k^5\times h^4k^2$
\item $18p^7q^2\div 6p^3q^5$
\item $(-10x^4y^3)\div(-2xy)$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(a^2)^3\times a^5$
\item $(b^3)^2\times(b^4)^3$
\item $(c^6)^2\div c^5$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\left(\dfrac{m^3}{n^2}\right)^2$
\item $\left(\dfrac{2p^2}{q}\right)^3$
\item $\left(\dfrac{-3x^2}{y^3}\right)^2$
\end{enumerate}

\item Given that $\dfrac{x^5(x^2)^{3n}}{x^{n+4}}=x^{21}$:
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Write the left-hand side as $x^{\text{(something)}}$.
\item Find $n$.
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each, leaving your answer in index notation where appropriate.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(ab^2)^3\times(2a^2b)^2$
\item $c^2d^4\times(-5c^3d)^2$
\end{enumerate}

\item Evaluate each without using a calculator.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $37^0$
\item $\left(-\dfrac{5}{9}\right)^0$
\item $(7m^3)^0$
\item $(-2a^4b)^0$
\end{enumerate}

\item Evaluate each without using a calculator.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $2^{-4}$
\item $(-3)^{-2}$
\item $\left(\dfrac{5}{2}\right)^{-3}$
\item $(7^2)^{-1}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Rewrite in radical form and hence evaluate (no calculator).
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $81^{1/2}$
\item $32^{1/5}$
\item $27^{-2/3}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Evaluate without using a calculator.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $216^{2/3}$
\item $16^{3/4}$
\item $8^{-4/3}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Express each in index notation (simplify where possible).
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\sqrt[3]{a^2}$
\item $\dfrac{1}{\sqrt[4]{b^3}}$
\item $(\sqrt{c})^5$
\end{enumerate}

\item Solve each equation.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $3^n=81$
\item $2^p=\dfrac1{64}$
\item $10^q=0.001$
\item $\dfrac1{256}=4^k$
\end{enumerate}

\item Given $64\times 4^{3/2}=2^n$:
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Evaluate $4^{3/2}$.
\item Find $n$.
\item Hence evaluate $2^{\,n-5}$.
\end{enumerate}

\item Kumar deposits \textdollar 4000 at $5\%$ per annum compounded yearly.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the amount after 2 years.
\item Find the total interest earned.
\end{enumerate}

\item A bank pays $6\%$ per annum compounded half-yearly on \textdollar 6000.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the amount after 3 years.
\item Find the interest earned (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item Express each number in standard form.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $0.0000456$
\item $93\,600\,000$
\item $0.00809$
\item $502\,000$
\end{enumerate}

\item Express each in ordinary notation.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $7.25\times10^5$
\item $4\times10^{-3}$
\item $1.08\times10^{-7}$
\item $3.6\times10^1$
\end{enumerate}

\item Calculate and give your answer in standard form, correct to 3 significant figures.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(2.4\times10^5)(3.5\times10^{-2})$
\item $(6.2\times10^{-4})\div(3.1\times10^2)$
\item $(5.6\times10^3)+(2.1\times10^4)$
\item A satellite travels at $7.8$ km/s. Find the distance travelled in 45 minutes, in metres in standard form.
\end{enumerate}

\end{enumerate}

\subsection*{20 Hard Questions}

\begin{enumerate}[label=\textbf{D\arabic*.}, leftmargin=*, itemsep=1.1em]

\item Simplify, expressing your answer in positive index form.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(a^{-3}b^2)^2\times(ab^{-1})^3$
\item $(x^4y^{-2})^{-1}\div(x^{-1}y^3)^2$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify, expressing your answer in positive index form.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\dfrac{(3m^2n^{-1})^3}{9m^{-1}n^2}$
\item $(-2p^{-3}q^2)^2\times(4pq^{-1})^{-1}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\dfrac{(2x^3y^2)^2(x^{-1}y^5)}{4x^2y^3}$
\item $(5a^0b^{-2})^{-3}\div(25b^4)$
\end{enumerate}

\item
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Simplify $(x^2y^{-3})^4(x^{-5}y^2)^2$ in positive index form.
\item Evaluate $\dfrac{(6k^{-2})^0+3^{-1}}{2^{-2}}$.
\end{enumerate}

\item Write each as a single power and hence solve for $n$.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\dfrac{3^{5}\cdot 3^{-2}\cdot 3^{n}}{3^{4}} = 3^{10}$
\item $\dfrac{2^{3n}\cdot 2^{4}}{2^{n-1}} = 2^{23}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Solve for $n$.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\dfrac{x^{5}(x^{3})^{2n-1}}{x^{n+4}}=x^{10}$
\item $\dfrac{(y^{2})^{n+1}}{y^{3n-5}}=y^{4}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Given that $3^a\times 9^b=3^{19}$ and $27^a\div 3^b=3^8$:
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find $a$ and $b$.
\item Hence find $3^{a-b}$.
\end{enumerate}

\item Evaluate without using a calculator.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $125^{-2/3}$
\item $81^{3/4}$
\item $\left(\dfrac{27}{8}\right)^{4/3}$ \quad (as a decimal)
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify, expressing your answers in positive index form.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\dfrac{1}{\sqrt[3]{a^5}}\times\sqrt[3]{a^2}$
\item $\dfrac{\sqrt[4]{16x^6}}{\sqrt{x}}$
\item $\dfrac{\sqrt[3]{27b^4}}{b^{1/3}}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Solve each equation (assume variables are positive).
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $p^{3/2}=27$
\item $q^{-1/2}=4$
\item $r^{4/3}=16$
\item $16^{x}=2^{10}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Evaluate without using a calculator.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(8^{-5/3})(2^{4})$
\item $(64^{1/2})\div(4^{-1})$
\item $16^{-3/4}+2^{-2}$
\end{enumerate}

\item \textdollar 12{,}000 is invested at $4.8\%$ per annum.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the amount after 5 years if compounded monthly (nearest cent).
\item Find the total interest (nearest cent).
\item Find the amount after 5 years if compounded yearly (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item An investment of \textdollar 8000 grows to \textdollar 9720 in 4 years compounded yearly.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the annual interest rate, correct to 2 decimal places.
\item Using this rate, find the amount after 4 years if compounded half-yearly (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item A loan charges $3.6\%$ per annum compounded quarterly. After 2 years, the amount owed is \textdollar 15{,}642.30.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the principal (nearest cent).
\item Find the total interest (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item Cheryl invested \textdollar 5000 and received \textdollar 5800 after 5 years compounded yearly.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the annual interest rate, correct to 2 decimal places.
\item Using this rate, find the amount after 5 years if compounded monthly (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item Calculate, giving your answer in standard form correct to 3 significant figures.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(3.6\times10^8)\div(9\times10^{-3})$
\item $(4.2\times10^{-7})+(5.8\times10^{-8})$
\item $(7.5\times10^5)-(6.98\times10^5)$
\end{enumerate}

\item Calculate, giving your answer in standard form correct to 3 significant figures.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(1.2\times10^3)^3$
\item $\dfrac{(6.4\times10^{-2})(3.0\times10^5)}{8\times10^3}$
\item $\dfrac{2.4\times10^{-10}}{7.5\times10^{-6}-2.5\times10^{-6}}$
\end{enumerate}

\item A virus has diameter $85$ nm and a bacterium has diameter $3.4\ \mu\text{m}$.
(Given $1\text{ nm}=10^{-9}\text{ m}$, $1\ \mu\text{m}=10^{-6}\text{ m}$.)
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Express both diameters in metres in standard form.
\item Express virus : bacterium as a ratio of two integers in simplest form.
\end{enumerate}

\item The speed of light is $3.00\times10^8$ m/s. A spacecraft is $7.8\times10^{10}$ m away.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the time taken for light to reach it, in seconds in standard form (3 s.f.).
\item Convert your time in (a) into minutes and seconds.
\item Express the distance in kilometres in standard form.
\end{enumerate}

\item The table shows approximate world population:
\begin{itemize}
\item 1800: $9.9\times10^8$
\item 1900: $1.65\times10^9$
\item 2000: $6.14\times10^9$
\item 2020: $7.80\times10^9$
\end{itemize}
Find:
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item the increase from 1800 to 1900 in standard form,
\item the number of times the population in 2000 is as large as in 1900 (3 s.f.),
\item the percentage of the world population in 2020 represented by $1.28\times10^9$ (3 s.f.).
\end{enumerate}

\end{enumerate}

content.text:
import fitz
from PIL import Image
pdf_path='/mnt/data/Think G3 Sec3 Chapter 3 Indices - review questions only.pdf'
doc=fitz.open(pdf_path)
imgs=[]
for i in range(len(doc)):
    page=doc[i]
    pix=page.get_pixmap(matrix=fitz.Matrix(2,2))
    img=Image.frombytes("RGB",[pix.width,pix.height],pix.samples)
    imgs.append(img)
    img.save(f'/mnt/data/review_page{i}.png')
pix.width, pix.height

# symbols
a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,k,m,n,p,q,r,u,v,x,y,z=sp.symbols('a b c d e f g h k m n p q r u v x y z', nonzero=True)

parts:
Here are **30 new difficult → maximum-difficulty questions** written to match the **wording, formats, and question-types** in **Exercises 3A–3C** and the **attached Review Exercise 3 / supplementary worksheet**. fileciteturn0file0 fileciteturn1file0

Conventions: **standard form** means \(A\times10^n\) where \(1\le A<10\) and \(n\in\mathbb{Z}\). **s.f.** = *significant figures*.

---

## 30 Questions

### 1. Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in **positive index form**.
(a) \((ab^2)^3 \times (a^3b^{-1})^2\)  
(b) \((6a^2b^{-3})^2 \div (3a^{-1}b^2)\)  
(c) \((x^{-2}y^3)^4 \div (x^5y^{-1})^2\)

### 2. Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in **positive index form**.
(a) \((2p^{-3}q^2)^3(4pq^{-1})^{-2}\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{(-3m^2n^{-1})^2}{9m^{-3}n^4}\)  
(c) \((5x^0y^{-2})^{-2}\div(25y^3)\)

### 3. Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in **positive index form**.
(a) \(6a\div a^{-2}+a^2\times a-\dfrac{4a^{-1}}{2a^{-3}}\)  
(b) \((4k)^3-12k(2k^2)+\dfrac{8}{k^{-2}}\)

### 4.  
(a) Express \(3^{2n+1}\times 9^{n-2}\div 27^{n}\) in the form \(3^{an+b}\).  
(b) Hence find \(n\) if the expression equals \(27\).  
(c) Express \(\dfrac{(3^n)^4\cdot 81}{9^{\,n-1}}\) as a single power of \(3\), and hence find \(n\) if it equals \(3^{10}\).

### 5. Evaluate each of the following **without using a calculator**.
(a) \(4^{-2}+\left(\dfrac14\right)^{-1}-(-2)^0\)  
(b) \(\left(\dfrac34\right)^{-2}-2^{-3}\)  
(c) \(\left(\dfrac{1000}{27}\right)^{-5/3}\) (give your answer as a decimal)

### 6. Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in **positive index form**.
(a) \(\sqrt[5]{p^7}\times\sqrt[3]{8p^2}\)  
(b) \((p^{-3/4}q^{2/5})^{4}\times(p^{1/2}q^{-1/5})^{5}\)  
(c) \(\dfrac{p^{2/3}q^{-4/5}}{(p^{-1/3}q^{1/5})^{-3}}\)

### 7. Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in **positive index form**.
(a) \(\sqrt[3]{a^2}\times\sqrt[4]{a^3}\div\sqrt[6]{a}\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{\sqrt[5]{243c^{10}}}{\sqrt[3]{27c^4}}\)  
(c) \(\left(\sqrt[4]{16d^6}\right)^2\div\sqrt{d^3}\)

### 8. Evaluate each of the following **without using a calculator**.
(a) \(216^{2/3}-16^{3/4}\)  
(b) \(81^{3/4}+8^{-2/3}\)  
(c) \((-125)^{1/3}\times(-8)^{-2/3}\)

### 9. Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in **positive index form**.
(a) \(\dfrac{(3x^{-2}y^5)^2(-2x^3y^{-1})^3}{9x^4y^2}\)  
(b) \(\left(\dfrac{x^{-4}y^{2}z^{-3}}{x^{3}y^{-1}z}\right)^{-2}\)  
(c) \(\dfrac{ab^{n-1}}{c^2}\times\dfrac{c^{n}d^2}{a^2b}\div\dfrac{b^{n+3}}{c^{\,n-2}d}\)  
(d) \(\dfrac{(a+b)^{m}}{ab^2}\div\dfrac{(a+b)^{m+3}}{a^2b}\)

### 10. Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in **positive index form**.
(a) \(\dfrac{(2x^{-1}y^3)^4(-3x^2y^{-5})^2}{6x^3y^{-1}}\)  
(b) \(\dfrac{(5p^{1/2}q^{-1/3})^{6}}{(25p^{-1}q^{2/3})^{2}}\)

### 11. Solve each of the following equations.
(a) \(16^{x}=8^{5}\)  
(b) \(9^{n-2}=27^{n+1}\)  
(c) \(\dfrac{10^{p}}{10^{3}}=0.001\)  
(d) \(4^{2k-1}=\dfrac{1}{64}\)

### 12. Given that \(x^{12}(x^{3})^{2n-1}\div(x^{-2})^{n}=x^{33}\):  
(a) Write the left-hand side as \(x^{\text{(something)}}\).  
(b) Hence find \(n\).

### 13. Given that
\[
\frac{(-6p^2q^{-1})^3}{-216pq^2}\div\frac{p^2}{q^4}=\frac{p^{a+b}}{q^{a-b}},
\]
(a) simplify the left-hand side to the form \(\dfrac{p^M}{q^N}\),  
(b) form a pair of simultaneous equations in \(a\) and \(b\),  
(c) hence find \(a\) and \(b\).

### 14. Given that \(3^{u}\times 9^{v}=3^{20}\) and \(27^{u}\div 3^{v}=3^{4}\):  
(a) form two linear equations in \(u\) and \(v\),  
(b) find \(u\) and \(v\),  
(c) hence evaluate \(3^{u-2v}\).

### 15.  
(a) Express \(25\) and \(125\) as powers of \(5\).  
(b) Solve \(5^{2x+1}\times 25=125^{x-2}\).

### 16.  
(a) Simplify \(\dfrac{(2x^{-1}y^2)^3}{(4x^2y^{-1})^2}\) in **positive index form**.  
(b) Hence evaluate it when \(x=2\) and \(y=4\).

### 17. A student tried to simplify \(\left(\dfrac{3x^2}{2y}\right)^2\).  
Student A wrote \(\dfrac{9x^4}{2y^2}\). Student B wrote \(\dfrac{3x^4}{4y^2}\).  
(i) State the misconception made by each student.  
(ii) Give the correct simplified expression.

### 18. Compound interest: \(\$18000\) is invested at \(3.9\%\) per annum **compounded monthly**.  
(a) Find the amount after 4 years (nearest cent).  
(b) Find the total interest earned (nearest cent).

### 19. A loan charges \(4.8\%\) per annum **compounded quarterly**. The interest added at the end of the first year is \(\$293.23\).  
(a) Find the principal (nearest dollar).  
(b) Find the total amount owed after 3 years (nearest cent).

### 20. Cheryl invested \(\$5000\) and received \(\$6200\) after 6 years, compounded yearly.  
(a) Find the annual interest rate, correct to 2 decimal places.  
(b) Using this nominal annual rate, find the amount after 6 years if compounded monthly (nearest cent).

### 21. Calculate each, giving your answer in **standard form**, correct to **3 s.f.**
(a) \((7.2\times10^8)(3.5\times10^{-4})\)  
(b) \((9.6\times10^{-5})\div(3.2\times10^{4})\)  
(c) \((4.05\times10^{7})-(7.8\times10^{6})\)  
(d) \(\dfrac{(5.6\times10^{9})+(2.4\times10^{8})}{(2.0\times10^{3})^{2}}\)  
(e) \(\dfrac{(3.7\times10^{-4})+(5.1\times10^{-5})}{6.0\times10^{-3}}\)

### 22. Given \(P=6.8\times10^{3}\) and \(Q=3.25\times10^{4}\), express each in **standard form** (3 s.f.).
(a) \(3P\times 2Q\)  
(b) \(Q-P\)  
(c) \(\dfrac{Q}{P}\)  
(d) \(\left(\dfrac{P}{Q}\right)^2\)

### 23. Given \(x=4\times10^{-3}\) and \(y=7\times10^{-4}\), evaluate \(x+12y\), giving your answer in **standard form**.

### 24. (Use \(1\text{ MHz}=10^{6}\text{ Hz}\), \(1\text{ GHz}=10^{9}\text{ Hz}\).)  
(a) Convert \(480\,000\,000\) Hz to MHz (standard form).  
(b) Convert \(72\) GHz to Hz (standard form).  
(c) Convert \(3.6\times10^{14}\) Hz to GHz (standard form).

### 25. Atomic radii: \(1\text{ pm}=10^{-12}\text{ m}\), \(1\text{ nm}=10^{-9}\text{ m}\).  
(a) A lithium atom has radius \(160\) pm. Express this in metres in standard form.  
(b) A chlorine atom has radius \(0.099\) nm. Express this in metres in standard form.  
(c) Express lithium : chlorine as a ratio of two integers in simplest form.

### 26. A probe travels at \(2.4\times10^{4}\) m/s and the distance is \(7.2\times10^{9}\) m.  
(a) Find the travel time in seconds in standard form (3 s.f.).  
(b) Convert your answer into hours (3 s.f.) and days (3 s.f.).

### 27. The table shows approximate world population:
- 1600: \(5.50\times10^{8}\)  
- 1700: \(6.20\times10^{8}\)  
- 1800: \(9.90\times10^{8}\)  
- 1900: \(1.65\times10^{9}\)

Find:
(a) the increase from 1600 to 1700 (standard form),  
(b) the number of times the population in 1900 is as large as that in 1700 (3 s.f.),  
(c) the percentage of the 1900 world population represented by \(1.28\times10^{9}\) (3 s.f.).

### 28. The diameter of a circular microorganism is \(12\) nanometres (nm).  
(Use \(\pi=3.142\) and \(1\text{ nm}=10^{-9}\text{ m}\).)  
(a) Find the circumference in metres, in standard form (3 s.f.).  
(b) Find the area in square metres, in standard form (3 s.f.).

### 29. The mass of a hydrogen atom is \(1.67\times10^{-24}\) g and the mass of an oxygen atom is \(2.66\times10^{-23}\) g.  
(a) Find the mass of a water molecule (2 H and 1 O), in standard form (3 s.f.).  
(b) Find the approximate number of water molecules in \(250\) g of water, in standard form (3 s.f.).

### 30. Calculate
\[
N=\frac{(2.5\times10^{6})\,(4\times10^{-3})^{2}}{5\times10^{4}}
\]
and give your answer in **standard form** (3 s.f.).

---

## Answer Key (final answers only)

1. (a) \(a^9b^4\) (b) \(\dfrac{12a^5}{b^8}\) (c) \(\dfrac{y^{14}}{x^{18}}\)  
2. (a) \(\dfrac{q^8}{2p^{11}}\) (b) \(\dfrac{m^7}{n^6}\) (c) \(\dfrac{y}{625}\)  
3. (a) \(7a^3-2a^2\) (b) \(40k^3+8k^2\)  
4. (a) \(3^{n-3}\) (b) \(n=6\) (c) \(3^{2n+6}\), so \(n=2\)  
5. (a) \(\dfrac{49}{16}\) (b) \(\dfrac{119}{72}\) (c) \(0.00243\)  
6. (a) \(2p^{31/15}\) (b) \(\dfrac{q^{3/5}}{p^{1/2}}\) (c) \(\dfrac{1}{p^{1/3}q^{1/5}}\)  
7. (a) \(a^{5/4}\) (b) \(c^{2/3}\) (c) \(4d^{3/2}\)  
8. (a) \(28\) (b) \(\dfrac{109}{4}\) (c) \(-\dfrac{5}{4}\)  
9. (a) \(-8xy^5\) (b) \(\dfrac{x^{14}z^{8}}{y^{6}}\) (c) \(\dfrac{c^{2n-4}d^3}{ab^5}\) (d) \(\dfrac{a}{b(a+b)^3}\)  
10. (a) \(\dfrac{24y^3}{x^3}\) (b) \(\dfrac{25p^5}{q^{10/3}}\)  
11. (a) \(x=\dfrac{15}{4}\) (b) \(n=-7\) (c) \(p=0\) (d) \(k=-1\)  
12. (a) \(x^{8n+9}\) (b) \(n=3\)  
13. (a) \(\dfrac{p^3}{q}\) (b) \(a+b=3,\ a-b=1\) (c) \(a=2,\ b=1\)  
14. (a) \(u+2v=20,\ 3u-v=4\) (b) \(u=4,\ v=8\) (c) \(3^{u-2v}=3^{-12}=\dfrac{1}{531441}\)  
15. (a) \(25=5^2,\ 125=5^3\) (b) \(x=9\)  
16. (a) \(\dfrac{y^8}{2x^7}\) (b) \(256\)  
17. A: didn’t square the \(2\). B: didn’t square the \(3\). Correct: \(\dfrac{9x^4}{4y^2}\)  
18. (a) \(\$21033.55\) (b) \(\$3033.55\)

\documentclass[12pt]{article}

\usepackage{amsmath,amssymb}
\usepackage[margin=1in]{geometry}
\usepackage{enumitem}

\setlength{\parindent}{0pt}

\begin{document}

\section*{Indices (Exercises 3A--3C + Supplementary Worksheet Style): Difficult \texorpdfstring{$\to$}{->} Maximum Difficulty}

\begin{enumerate}[label=\textbf{\arabic*.}, leftmargin=*, itemsep=1.1em]

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in \textbf{positive index form}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(ab^2)^3 \times (a^3b^{-1})^2$
\item $(6a^2b^{-3})^2 \div (3a^{-1}b^2)$
\item $(x^{-2}y^3)^4 \div (x^5y^{-1})^2$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in \textbf{positive index form}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(2p^{-3}q^2)^3(4pq^{-1})^{-2}$
\item $\dfrac{(-3m^2n^{-1})^2}{9m^{-3}n^4}$
\item $(5x^0y^{-2})^{-2}\div(25y^3)$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in \textbf{positive index form}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $6a\div a^{-2}+a^2\times a-\dfrac{4a^{-1}}{2a^{-3}}$
\item $(4k)^3-12k(2k^2)+\dfrac{8}{k^{-2}}$
\end{enumerate}

\item
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Express $3^{2n+1}\times 9^{n-2}\div 27^{n}$ in the form $3^{an+b}$.
\item Hence find $n$ if the expression equals $27$.
\item Express $\dfrac{(3^n)^4\cdot 81}{9^{\,n-1}}$ as a single power of $3$, and hence find $n$ if it equals $3^{10}$.
\end{enumerate}

\item Evaluate each of the following \textbf{without using a calculator}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $4^{-2}+\left(\dfrac14\right)^{-1}-(-2)^0$
\item $\left(\dfrac34\right)^{-2}-2^{-3}$
\item $\left(\dfrac{1000}{27}\right)^{-5/3}$ \quad (give your answer as a decimal)
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in \textbf{positive index form}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\sqrt[5]{p^7}\times\sqrt[3]{8p^2}$
\item $(p^{-3/4}q^{2/5})^{4}\times(p^{1/2}q^{-1/5})^{5}$
\item $\dfrac{p^{2/3}q^{-4/5}}{(p^{-1/3}q^{1/5})^{-3}}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in \textbf{positive index form}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\sqrt[3]{a^2}\times\sqrt[4]{a^3}\div\sqrt[6]{a}$
\item $\dfrac{\sqrt[5]{243c^{10}}}{\sqrt[3]{27c^4}}$
\item $\left(\sqrt[4]{16d^6}\right)^2\div\sqrt{d^3}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Evaluate each of the following \textbf{without using a calculator}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $216^{2/3}-16^{3/4}$
\item $81^{3/4}+8^{-2/3}$
\item $(-125)^{1/3}\times(-8)^{-2/3}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in \textbf{positive index form}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\dfrac{(3x^{-2}y^5)^2(-2x^3y^{-1})^3}{9x^4y^2}$
\item $\left(\dfrac{x^{-4}y^{2}z^{-3}}{x^{3}y^{-1}z}\right)^{-2}$
\item $\dfrac{ab^{n-1}}{c^2}\times\dfrac{c^{n}d^2}{a^2b}\div\dfrac{b^{n+3}}{c^{\,n-2}d}$
\item $\dfrac{(a+b)^{m}}{ab^2}\div\dfrac{(a+b)^{m+3}}{a^2b}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Simplify each of the following, leaving your answer in \textbf{positive index form}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $\dfrac{(2x^{-1}y^3)^4(-3x^2y^{-5})^2}{6x^3y^{-1}}$
\item $\dfrac{(5p^{1/2}q^{-1/3})^{6}}{(25p^{-1}q^{2/3})^{2}}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Solve each of the following equations.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $16^{x}=8^{5}$
\item $9^{n-2}=27^{n+1}$
\item $\dfrac{10^{p}}{10^{3}}=0.001$
\item $4^{2k-1}=\dfrac{1}{64}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Given that $x^{12}(x^{3})^{2n-1}\div(x^{-2})^{n}=x^{33}$:
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Write the left-hand side as $x^{\text{(something)}}$.
\item Hence find $n$.
\end{enumerate}

\item Given that
\[
\frac{(-6p^2q^{-1})^3}{-216pq^2}\div\frac{p^2}{q^4}=\frac{p^{a+b}}{q^{a-b}},
\]
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item simplify the left-hand side to the form $\dfrac{p^M}{q^N}$,
\item form a pair of simultaneous equations in $a$ and $b$,
\item hence find $a$ and $b$.
\end{enumerate}

\item Given that $3^{u}\times 9^{v}=3^{20}$ and $27^{u}\div 3^{v}=3^{4}$:
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item form two linear equations in $u$ and $v$,
\item find $u$ and $v$,
\item hence evaluate $3^{u-2v}$.
\end{enumerate}

\item
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Express $25$ and $125$ as powers of $5$.
\item Solve $5^{2x+1}\times 25=125^{x-2}$.
\end{enumerate}

\item
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Simplify $\dfrac{(2x^{-1}y^2)^3}{(4x^2y^{-1})^2}$ in \textbf{positive index form}.
\item Hence evaluate it when $x=2$ and $y=4$.
\end{enumerate}

\item A student tried to simplify $\left(\dfrac{3x^2}{2y}\right)^2$.\\
Student A wrote $\dfrac{9x^4}{2y^2}$. Student B wrote $\dfrac{3x^4}{4y^2}$.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\roman*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item State the misconception made by each student.
\item Give the correct simplified expression.
\end{enumerate}

\item Compound interest: \textdollar 18000 is invested at $3.9\%$ per annum \textbf{compounded monthly}.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the amount after 4 years (nearest cent).
\item Find the total interest earned (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item A loan charges $4.8\%$ per annum \textbf{compounded quarterly}. The interest added at the end of the first year is \textdollar 293.23.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the principal (nearest dollar).
\item Find the total amount owed after 3 years (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item Cheryl invested \textdollar 5000 and received \textdollar 6200 after 6 years, compounded yearly.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the annual interest rate, correct to 2 decimal places.
\item Using this nominal annual rate, find the amount after 6 years if compounded monthly (nearest cent).
\end{enumerate}

\item Calculate each, giving your answer in \textbf{standard form}, correct to \textbf{3 s.f.}
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $(7.2\times10^8)(3.5\times10^{-4})$
\item $(9.6\times10^{-5})\div(3.2\times10^{4})$
\item $(4.05\times10^{7})-(7.8\times10^{6})$
\item $\dfrac{(5.6\times10^{9})+(2.4\times10^{8})}{(2.0\times10^{3})^{2}}$
\item $\dfrac{(3.7\times10^{-4})+(5.1\times10^{-5})}{6.0\times10^{-3}}$
\end{enumerate}

\item Given $P=6.8\times10^{3}$ and $Q=3.25\times10^{4}$, express each in \textbf{standard form} (3 s.f.).
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item $3P\times 2Q$
\item $Q-P$
\item $\dfrac{Q}{P}$
\item $\left(\dfrac{P}{Q}\right)^2$
\end{enumerate}

\item Given $x=4\times10^{-3}$ and $y=7\times10^{-4}$, evaluate $x+12y$, giving your answer in \textbf{standard form}.

\item (Use $1\text{ MHz}=10^{6}\text{ Hz}$, $1\text{ GHz}=10^{9}\text{ Hz}$.)
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Convert $480\,000\,000$ Hz to MHz (standard form).
\item Convert $72$ GHz to Hz (standard form).
\item Convert $3.6\times10^{14}$ Hz to GHz (standard form).
\end{enumerate}

\item Atomic radii: $1\text{ pm}=10^{-12}\text{ m}$, $1\text{ nm}=10^{-9}\text{ m}$.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item A lithium atom has radius $160$ pm. Express this in metres in standard form.
\item A chlorine atom has radius $0.099$ nm. Express this in metres in standard form.
\item Express lithium : chlorine as a ratio of two integers in simplest form.
\end{enumerate}

\item A probe travels at $2.4\times10^{4}$ m/s and the distance is $7.2\times10^{9}$ m.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the travel time in seconds in standard form (3 s.f.).
\item Convert your answer into hours (3 s.f.) and days (3 s.f.).
\end{enumerate}

\item The table shows approximate world population:
\begin{itemize}
\item 1600: $5.50\times10^{8}$
\item 1700: $6.20\times10^{8}$
\item 1800: $9.90\times10^{8}$
\item 1900: $1.65\times10^{9}$
\end{itemize}
Find:
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item the increase from 1600 to 1700 (standard form),
\item the number of times the population in 1900 is as large as that in 1700 (3 s.f.),
\item the percentage of the 1900 world population represented by $1.28\times10^{9}$ (3 s.f.).
\end{enumerate}

\item The diameter of a circular microorganism is $12$ nanometres (nm).\\
(Use $\pi=3.142$ and $1\text{ nm}=10^{-9}\text{ m}$.)
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the circumference in metres, in standard form (3 s.f.).
\item Find the area in square metres, in standard form (3 s.f.).
\end{enumerate}

\item The mass of a hydrogen atom is $1.67\times10^{-24}$ g and the mass of an oxygen atom is $2.66\times10^{-23}$ g.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*), itemsep=0.3em]
\item Find the mass of a water molecule (2 H and 1 O), in standard form (3 s.f.).
\item Find the approximate number of water molecules in $250$ g of water, in standard form (3 s.f.).
\end{enumerate}

\item Calculate
\[
N=\frac{(2.5\times10^{6})\,(4\times10^{-3})^{2}}{5\times10^{4}}
\]
and give your answer in \textbf{standard form} (3 s.f.).

\end{enumerate}
